result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt:
3:24 PM Defendant Tevin Marquis Smith appeared by video.  Attorney Jordan W. Feest appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Luke K Harrison appeared by video for Tevin Marquis Smith.  Inducement made.  Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 1 for further proceedings.  Defendant wishes to exercise his right to substitution.  Further proceedings to be scheduled with newly assigned judge.
ARRAIGNMENT
Information filed.  Not guilty plea(s).  Jury Calendar.  Offer deadline is set for August 26, 2022.
Minutes.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on July 20, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

2:39 pm - Prosecuting attorney Marconi De Franca Barros in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Tevin Marquis Smith in court.  Attorney Luke K Harrison in court for Tevin Marquis Smith. Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
RE:  Threat to Law Enforcement Officer, on 06-15-22.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of felony bail jumping and battery/threat to law enforcement officer.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 07-11-22 at 1:30 p.m. Br. 1.  Bail is set at $2,000.00 recognizance bond with the condition that he maintain absolute sobriety.  Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody. Court orders photos and prints at MTPD MTSO TRPD.
Minutes.
